Container.Name: ArchiveBox
Container.Overview: ArchiveBox is a powerful, self-hosted internet archiving solution to collect, save, and view websites offline. Without active preservation effort, everything on the internet eventually disappears or degrades. Archive.org does a great job as a centralized service, but saved URLs have to be public, and they can't save every type of content. ArchiveBox is an open source tool that lets organizations & individuals archive both public & private web content while retaining control over their data. It can be used to save copies of bookmarks, preserve evidence for legal cases, backup photos from FB/Insta/Flickr or media from YT/Soundcloud/etc., save research papers, and more...
Container.Requires: To setup an admin account, you have to open the console and type "su archivebox" and then "archivebox manage createsuperuser". It asks you then for the admin account name, email and password.

Config.Name: Archive Data
Config.Description: Contains all the data thats being archived.

Config.Name: Public Index
Config.Description: set to False to prevent anonymous users from viewing snapshot list

Config.Name: Public Snapshots
Config.Description: set to False to prevent anonymous users from viewing snapshot content

Config.Name: Public Add View
Config.Description: set to True to allow anonymous users to submit new URLs to archive

Config.Name: Timeout
Config.Description: increase this number to 120+ seconds if you see many slow downloads timing out

Config.Name: Curl User Agent
Config.Description: set a custom CURL_USER_AGENT to avoid being blocked as a bot

Config.Name: Wget User Agent
Config.Description: set a custom WGET_USER_AGENT to avoid being blocked as a bot

Config.Name: Chrome User Agent
Config.Description: set a custom CHROME_USER_AGENT to avoid being blocked as a bot
